author: rebeccacnreid
title: This hair dye will adapt its colour according to your surroundings
text:
Black to red in a matter of seconds. (Picture: The Unseen) It might sound like something from a YA novel, but it’s not. 
Someone's making a 'feminine lipstick' that glues your labia shut to seal in your period There really is a hair dye which will make your hair change colour depending on the surroundings.
The dye is called ‘fire’ and basically, it shifts from bright red through to black depending on the temperature around you. So if your office is chilly, you can neatly dark haired, and then when you go to a nice warm pub after work? Fire engine hair.
If red isn’t your vibe then the dye is also coming in pastel shades. So you can have mermaid hair part time without having to fully commit to the aesthetic.
&&&&& To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video 
The dye has been created by Lauren Bowker, founder of the company The Unseen. It’s not been made clear whether Lauren has any powers of sorcery, so we’re assuming not.

Only a bit of bad news: the dye, which will be semi-permanent, isn’t on the market yet. The Unseen are looking for commercial partners, so if you love the iea (why wouldn’t you?) and you have lots of money, please go give it to them so we can all have part-time unicorn hair.
